meanings.definition: The process of cleansing and thickening cloth by soaking and beating it.
meanings.sent1: The fulling of the fabric made it softer and thicker.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of fulling from her grandmother, who was a skilled textile worker.
meanings.sent3: The fulling of the cloth was so vigorous that it seemed like a dance of fabric and water.
meanings.sent4: The fulling process transformed the plain material into a luxurious and durable fabric.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of fulling echoed through the workshop, creating a mesmerizing atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The act of making something full or complete.
meanings.sent1: His support was the fulling that completed her sense of security.
meanings.sent2: The final brushstroke on the painting was the fulling touch that brought it to life.
meanings.sent3: The last ingredient added to the recipe was the fulling that made the dish perfect.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the fulling to the joyful atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent5: The missing piece of the puzzle was the fulling that finally solved the mystery.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming full or filled.
meanings.sent1: The fulling of the glass with water was a refreshing sight on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The fulling of the room with laughter signaled a successful gathering.
meanings.sent3: The fulling of the basket with fruits brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt the fulling of love as he looked into her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The fulling of the sky with stars painted a beautiful night scene.
